## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 278, 904, 293]]<|/det|>
0606/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 302, 150, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 303, 904, 317]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 399]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 221, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 855, 604]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a scientific calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- For \(\pi\) , use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 633, 212, 647]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 728, 681]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 73, 567, 88]]<|/det|>
List of formulas 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 106, 783, 124]]<|/det|>
Equation of a circle with centre \((a, b)\) and radius \(r\). \((x - a)^2 + (y - b)^2 = r^2\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 155, 675, 173]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\). \(A = \pi rl\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 202, 683, 220]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(A = 4\pi r^2\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 245, 680, 274]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid or cone, base area \(A\), height \(h\). \(V = \frac{1}{3} Ah\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 293, 683, 321]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 348, 655, 365]]<|/det|>
Quadratic equation For the equation \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\), 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 367, 560, 402]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 446, 225, 462]]<|/det|>
Binomial theorem 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 435, 905, 475]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^n = a^n + \binom{n}{1} a^{n-1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n-2}b^2 + \dots + \binom{n}{r} a^{n-r}b^r + \dots + b^n,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 482, 770, 523]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n-r)!r!}\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 554, 217, 570]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 552, 667, 595]]<|/det|>
\[u_n = a + (n-1)d \\ S_n = \frac{1}{2}n(a+l) = \frac{1}{2}n\{2a+(n-1)d\}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 631, 217, 647]]<|/det|>
Geometric series 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 628, 570, 710]]<|/det|>
\[u_n = ar^{n-1} \\ S_n = \frac{a(1-r^n)}{1-r} \quad (r \neq 1) \\ S_\infty = \frac{a}{1-r} \quad (|r| < 1)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 740, 158, 756]]<|/det|>
Identities 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 738, 555, 788]]<|/det|>
\[\begin{align*} \sin^2 A + \cos^2 A &= 1 \\ \sec^2 A &= 1 + \tan^2 A \\ \cos e^2 A &= 1 + \cot^2 A \end{align*}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 828, 240, 844]]<|/det|>
Formulas for \(\Delta ABC\) 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 822, 576, 900]]<|/det|>
\[\begin{align*} \frac{a}{\sin A} &= \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C} \\ a^2 &= b^2 + c^2 - 2bc \cos A \\ \Delta &= \frac{1}{2} ab \sin C \end{align*}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 72, 101, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 72, 616, 88]]<|/det|>
In this question, all lengths are in metres and time is in seconds.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 102, 917, 134]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) moves in a straight line such that its displacement \(s\) from a fixed point \(O\) at time \(t\) is given by \(s=(t-4)^{2}(t-1)\) for \(t \geqslant 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 149, 136, 165]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 149, 858, 165]]<|/det|>
On the axes, sketch the displacement–time graph of \(P\), stating the intercepts with the axes. [2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 177, 885, 540]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 540, 136, 556]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 540, 494, 572]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for the velocity, \(v\), of \(P\). Give your answer in a factorised form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 552, 916, 568]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 818, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 445, 916, 461]]<|/det|>

<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[120, 72, 360, 87]]<|/det|>
Functions f and g are such that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[355, 102, 560, 128]]<|/det|>
\[
f(x)=\frac{3 x}{x+4} \quad \text { for } x>0
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[355, 138, 570, 157]]<|/det|>
\[
g(x)=\sqrt{x+2} \quad \text { for } x>-2 .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 173, 359, 189]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\mathrm{fg}(x)=1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 173, 916, 189]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 80, 108, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 80, 136, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 680, 100]]<|/det|>
Given that \(y=4 \sin 2 x \cos 2 x\), find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}\) when \(x=\frac{\pi}{6}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 80, 916, 96]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 410, 136, 426]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 410, 485, 426]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y=4 \sin 2 x \cos 2 x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 438, 787, 460]]<|/det|>
The normal to the curve at the point where \(x=\frac{\pi}{6}\) meets the \(x\)-axis at the point \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 471, 405, 487]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 471, 916, 487]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 72, 101, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 72, 136, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 749, 100]]<|/det|>
A 4-digit number is to be formed using the digits 0, 2, 4, 5, 6 and 8. The 4-digit number must not start with 0.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 610, 118]]<|/det|>
Any digit may be used at most once in the 4-digit number.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 133, 184, 149]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 133, 568, 149]]<|/det|>
Find how many 4-digit numbers can be formed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 916, 149]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 212, 184, 228]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 212, 610, 228]]<|/det|>
Find how many even 4-digit numbers can be formed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 212, 916, 228]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 352, 184, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 352, 740, 368]]<|/det|>
Find how many 4-digit numbers that are divisible by 5 can be formed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 352, 916, 368]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 537, 136, 553]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 537, 616, 555]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\left(n+1\right) \times{ }^{n+1} \mathrm{C}_{12}=33\left(n-10\right) \times{ }^{n} \mathrm{C}_{10}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 537, 916, 553]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[60, 0, 415, 70]]<|/det|>
 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 78, 700, 94]]<|/det|>
<pre>6 The volume, \(V\), of a sphere is increasing at the constant rate of \(2\pi \mathrm{~cm}^{3} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 94, 920, 110]]<|/det|>
Find the rate of change of the surface area, \(S\), of this sphere when the volume of the sphere is \(36\pi \mathrm{~cm}^{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 110, 916, 126]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 72, 101, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 72, 638, 88]]<|/det|>
The first three terms of an arithmetic progression can be written as

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[241, 99, 465, 118]]<|/det|>
\[
2 \ln \left(x^{3}\right), \quad 5 \ln \left(x^{2}\right), \quad 2 \ln \left(x^{7}\right).
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 134, 136, 150]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 134, 918, 170]]<|/det|>
Given that \(x>1\), find the least number of terms for the sum of this progression to be greater than \(43 \ln \left(x^{24}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 151, 916, 167]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 136, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 817, 89]]<|/det|>
Given that the 25th term of this progression is equal to 408, find the exact value of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 916, 89]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 75, 95, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 93, 885, 410]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 424, 520, 451]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y=\frac{15}{x}-\frac{5}{x^{2}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 459, 442, 472]]<|/det|>
The curve meets the \(x\)-axis at the point \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 474, 440, 488]]<|/det|>
The curve has a maximum at the point \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 521, 687, 536]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region enclosed by the line \(A B\) and the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 552, 372, 566]]<|/det|>
Give your answer in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 552, 916, 566]]<|/det|>

Continuation of working space for Question 8.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 75, 101, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[120, 75, 136, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 682, 91]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(3 \sec 3x = \sqrt{3} \cos e 3x\) for \(-120^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 120^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 916, 91]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 80, 136, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 743, 96]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(2 \cos \left(y+\frac{\pi}{3}\right) \sin \left(y+\frac{\pi}{3}\right)=\sin \left(y+\frac{\pi}{3}\right)\) for \(0 \leqslant y<2 \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 80, 916, 96]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[333, 840, 664, 856]]<|/det|>
<pre>Question 10 is printed on the next page.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 84, 117, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 80, 918, 120]]<|/det|>
The first three terms, in descending powers of \(x\), in the expansion of \(\left(3 x^{2}-a\right)^{n}\left(1+\frac{1}{x^{2}}\right)^{2}\) can be written as \(729 x^{12}+972 x^{10}+b x^{8}\), where \(a, b\) and \(n\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 136, 347, 152]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a, b\) and \(n\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 136, 916, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]
